messages.subject: Re: Any unschoolers near SLO, CA?
messages.msgSnippet: It got cold here last weekend but it is warming up. I think it may still be too cold for slide rock but anywhere along the river will be nice for hiking
messages.messageBody:
It got cold here last weekend but it is warming up. I think it may
still be too cold for slide rock but anywhere along the river will be
nice for hiking around. My son is also a gamer but loves to go to the
trout farm and fish. It can get pricey, you have to pay for the fish
you catch and can't catch and release, but its a blast for the kids
and exciting as you can see them. There is also Page Springs Hatchery
which is neat to visit. Take a drive up the canyon toward Flag and
you can stop along the river and hike down along it, that's always
nice. My homeschooling (mostly unschooling) group meets at Sunset
Parker on Thursdays starting at 11:00. Kids are ages 5 up to 13. Its
casual and fun. Turn east at the Walgreens on Sunset and go just a
little ways, you'll see the park on your right. Feel free to join us
and get some more ideas from others there.

Janice

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Any unschoolers near SLO, CA?
messages.msgSnippet: Join HSC - (HomeSchool Association of California) - it is the most unschooling-friendly of the state organizations.  Call or email the HSC county
messages.messageBody:
Join HSC - (HomeSchool Association of California) - it is the most
unschooling-friendly of the state organizations.
<HSC.org>

Call or email the HSC county contact and ask about making local
connections.
<http://hsc.org/countycontacts.html#sa>

Join the HSC email list and post that you're looking for contacts and
activities.
To join, send a blank email to:
<ca-Homeschooling-HSC-subscribe@yahoogroups.com>

If you like to camp, be sure to go to the HSC campouts - there are
always a couple not too far from SLO every year - Refugio State Beach
and Big Sur, for example.

Homeschoolers of the Central Coast looks like it is a currently active
group and is relaxed and casual.
<http://groups.yahoo.com/group/Homeschoolers_of_the_Central_Coast/>

Welcome to California. SLO is a great place to live!


-Pam

From: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
[mailto:unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of holistic_living
Sent: Monday, May 26, 2008 6:12 PM
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [unschoolingbasics] Any unschoolers near SLO, CA?



I have a 8 1/2-yr old son who I have been unschooling for a little over
a year now. We are moving to Arroyo Grande soon and the hardest thing
is leaving all of the great friendships we've developed here in Sedona.
We are hoping to find some homeschoolers there that we can interact and
have fun with. If anyone is out there and interested in getting
together, please let us know. Its seems to be his one and only real
concern about moving, other than that, we are all very excited about
our big change from the mountains to the beach! You can email me
directly or feel free to call me at 928-202-6119.

Janice (son Parker)

messages.msgSnippet: Hi Janice, Sorry I can t help you with finding friends in CA, but I m heading to Sedona on Friday, to spend a week s vacation with extended family.  I m
messages.messageBody:
Hi Janice,

Sorry I can't help you with finding friends in CA, but I'm heading to Sedona
on Friday, to spend a week's vacation with extended family. I'm wondering
if you have any kid-friendly places you might recommend?
I have a 9 yr old girl & a 12 yr old boy. I'm afraid my son won't know what
to do with himself without his
Xbox LOL. Is Slide Rock going to be warm enough at this time of year?

thanks,
heather
in tucson

messages.subject: Any unschoolers near SLO, CA?
messages.msgSnippet: I have a 8 1/2-yr old son who I have been unschooling for a little over a year now. We are moving to Arroyo Grande soon and the hardest thing is leaving all of
messages.messageBody:
I have a 8 1/2-yr old son who I have been unschooling for a little over
a year now. We are moving to Arroyo Grande soon and the hardest thing
is leaving all of the great friendships we've developed here in Sedona.
We are hoping to find some homeschoolers there that we can interact and
have fun with. If anyone is out there and interested in getting
together, please let us know. Its seems to be his one and only real
concern about moving, other than that, we are all very excited about
our big change from the mountains to the beach! You can email me
directly or feel free to call me at 928-202-6119.

Janice (son Parker)
